tweets.text: 2212 complaints about one site in a week. To put that into context, that is more than the @EnvAgencyMids and the wider @EnvAgency would expect to see NATIONALLY, over a MONTH for all the sites and incidents they are responsible for. It is imperative to #stopthestink. https://t.co/A0qDU8lGPQ https://t.co/FsL5xnoo7m

@munirawilson We are dealing with a poorly regulated landfill in Newcastle under Lyme. It is a national issue for @EnvAgency It is causing community misery, we need air purifiers just to sleep. Gases are also getting into schools and hospitals locally. I‚Äôve filled in your survey. #stopthestink

@EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgencyMids so we get tweets and letters from you and that's good but it's about time you spoke to us face to face in our toxic gas filled town. Don't use COVID as an excuse it can be done. We suffocate every day do you want deaths on your hands. @StinkStopthe @ClientEarth

We want our fresh air back and cannot trust red to manage the site , and even more no trust in you regulating it ! @StinkStopthe

Great theme for @cleanairdayuk We have a Clean Air Day in the UK yet the authorities continue to allow our children to inhale strong landfill gases every day in Newcastle under Lyme. We need your help @Cap_it_off @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @robbiewilliams #stopthestink https://t.co/pN48Oi1a4g

tweets.text:
Our officers have today inspected the metal recycling site in Hunslet and surrounding area following the fire yesterday evening. 

No impacts on the local environment have been identified.

We'll work with the site operator to ensure they carry out a safe clean up. https://t.co/GHLQnh9XSF
